text:
There is a problem that appears when using FOP 0.20.5.
Including svg with an url for Microsoft IIS leads to http-error 406.
In some cases <1% I got that error with Apache.
I never got that error with files.
I debugged the FOP source code but found that the exception was thrown by Batik.
Any ideas how to solve tha problem?
Regards,
Jo
creator: joachim.unger@softwareag.com
deweese@apache.org
text:
Can you provide more information?
Version of Batik? (1.5)
What is the stack trace from the exception?

Created attachment 9147
Find some hardcopies of the bug location in FOP but have no BATIK code
creator: joachim.unger@softwareag.com

text:
It looks to me like the IIS server is improperly configured.
Looking it up a 406 means that the server can't provide any
of the accepted media types for the requested resource.  This
probably means that the IIS server doesn't know that the 
'.svg' file is an 'image/svg+xml' media type.

If you don't think this is the problem feel free to reopen
the bug.
creator: deweese@apache.org
